content: The average person walks the equivalent of three times around the Earth in their lifetime.,FALSE,
A blue whale's heart is so large that a human could swim through its arteries
Bees can recognize human faces
A duck's quack doesn't echo, and no one knows why
Most laugh tracks on TV sitcoms were recorded in the 1950s. Many of the people you hear laughing are now deceased
Bananas are, botanically speaking, berries, while strawberries are not
In Switzerland, it is illegal to own just one guinea pig because they are considered social animals and suffer from loneliness
There are more possible arrangements of a chess game than there are atoms in the observable universe
There is enough iron in the human body to make one small nail
Honey never spoils. Archaeologists have found thousands of years old honey in Egyptian tombs that was still edible
Octopuses have three hearts
A dog's nose print is as unique as a human's fingerprint
The Hawaiian alphabet has only 13 letters
It rains diamonds on Jupiter and Saturn
The country with the most pyramids is not Egypt, but Sudan
France was the last country to use the guillotine. The last execution took place in 1977
The first product to have a barcode was a pack of Wrigley's gum
The nutcracker was invented before the rifle
The world's longest traffic jam lasted for 12 days and was over 100 kilometers long
A snail can sleep for up to three years
The probability that in any glass of water you drink, there is a molecule of water that once passed through a dinosaur is almost 100%
In Japan, there are "crying rooms" (rui-katsu) where people can go to cry to relieve stress
The highest recorded speed of a raindrop is around 28 km/h
The hummingbird is the only bird that can fly backward
Sea otters hold hands with other otters while sleeping on the water to keep from drifting away
Cleopatra lived closer in time to the invention of the iPhone than to the construction of the Great Pyramid of Giza
A rattlesnake can still bite for several hours after its head has been cut off
The first oranges weren't orange, but green
Nintendo was founded in 1889 as a playing card company
The quietest room in the world, an anechoic chamber at Orfield Laboratories in the US, is so quiet that you can hear your own blood circulation
Sweden has such an efficient recycling system that it has to import trash from other countries to keep its recycling plants running
The longest place name in the world has 85 letters and is located in New Zealand
Your eyeballs remain the same size from birth for your entire life, while your nose and ears never stop growing
In Scotland, there are more than 400 words for snow
A goldfish kept in the dark will gradually lose its color and turn pale
The average four-year-old asks about 400 questions a day
The sound of a whip cracking is not caused by the impact, but by its tip breaking the speed of sound

On Venus, a day lasts longer than a year
An ant can survive a fall from any height

Lego is the world's largest tire manufacturer (for its toy sets)
The average cloud weighs around 500 tons, which is the weight of about 80 elephants
In your lifetime, you will eat approximately 35 tons of food
There are more plastic flamingos in the world than real ones
In Utah, it is illegal to hunt whales. Utah is a landlocked state
